title: Topsy Turvy
body:
We chase logic. And we seek reason.
Try to control, both the ship and its captain.
Nightmares turned to dreams, dreams into reality.
How long until another impossible's made to happen?

But a little too often, these dreams turn ridiculous.
Like a longing to be dragged, into a parallel universe.
Where gravity pulls us up, everything else, nebulous.
Where things'd be different, for better or for worse.

For when space and time, neither stretch nor bend,
Trees grow into seeds, and thunder sounds first,
There will be no end to life, and yet, no life to end.
As the law of reverse effect, itself would be reversed.

Where it's tropical at the poles, freezing at sea level.Homes built from lego, clouds our riding vessel.
Where the sea leaves burns and fire cools its flame.
People see your passion, nobody asks your name.

And if stars could talk, they'd let you in on this secret.
That nothing is a mystery and nothing is amiss.
And yet, trying to make sense of it, do try & tell me,
How could a world, get any topsy-turvier than this?
